    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets methods and the robot's position, either to whatever argument is/arguments are passed in, or, in the case of no arguments, to (0, 0, 0), also resets the encoder positions.

      • reset

        public void reset(float x,
                  float z,
                  float rot)
        Resets methods and the robot's position, either to whatever argument is/arguments are passed in, or, in the case of no arguments, to (0, 0, 0), also resets the encoder positions.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate for the robot to reset to
        z - The z coordinate that the robot needs to reset to
        rot - The rotation angle

      • reset

        public void reset(Location resetPos)
        Resets methods and the robot's position, either to whatever argument is/arguments are passed in, or, in the case of no arguments, to (0, 0, 0), also resets the encoder positions.
        Parameters:
        resetPos - a position for the robot to reset to

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition()
        Update Position Method Updates position to where the robot currently is. Counter-clockwise rotation is negative. Loooooots of math exists here, we have to take into account the encoder positions and how they've changed since the previous read.

      • getEncoderPosition

        public int[] getEncoderPosition()
        Get's the position of the encoder
        Returns:
        encoderPosition the position of the encoder
